marketNews.title: Powell Signals Opportunity to Cut Interest Rates
marketNews.content:
The Fed Chair, Jerome Powell, in his speech on Friday (22/8) local time, signaled that the central bank is opening the possibility of cutting US interest rates at the September 2025 meeting, marking a shift in tone from the central bank's hawkish stance amid uncertainty over President Donald Trump's tariffs. However, Powell asserted that they do not yet have a definite decision.
Powell stated that based on the Fed's baseline outlook, risks to the labor market are increasing, while the impact of tariffs on inflation is expected to be only temporary. Before Powell delivered his speech, the market had anticipated a Fed rate cut in September 2025 following weak US labor data for the period of May-July 2025.
Powell also announced that the Fed will re-adopt Flexible Inflation Targeting (FIT) as its future monetary policy framework. The Chief Economist at RSM US LLP, Joe Brusuelas, told Reuters that this framework change indicates the Fed's stance will lean more towards higher-for-longer, even though the probability of cutting interest rates in the short term has increased.
Responding to Powell's speech, the probability of a US rate cut at the September 2025 meeting increased from ~83% a week ago to ~85% as of today, Monday (25/8), based on analysis from the CME FedWatch Tool. Meanwhile, the probability of a US rate cut of more than =50 bps until the end of the year increased from ~81% to ~83%.
The Fed meeting itself will take place on September 16-17, 2025. Before that meeting, monthly US labor data will be released on September 5, 2025, followed by the release of monthly inflation data the following week, which could influence the Fed's decision.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: A rate cut has the potential to increase the attractiveness of risk assets, including emerging market assets like Indonesia. Responding to Powell's relatively dovish speech, the US stock market reacted positively with the S&P500 and Nasdaq strengthening by +1.52% and +1.54% respectively on Friday (22/8) local time. Meanwhile, the IHSG rose +0.87% in today's trading, with sectors sensitive to interest rates such as Finance (+1.87%) and Property (+3.65%) strengthening quite significantly. A Fed rate cut itself can provide further room for Bank Indonesia to lower the BI Rate. Bank Indonesia itself estimates that the Fed will still cut interest rates by -50 bps until the end of the year.

marketNews.title: Other hot things you need to know...
marketNews.content:
1. A World Trade Organization (WTO) panel on Friday (22/8) supported Indonesia on several key claims in the dispute regarding countervailing duties imposed by the European Union on biodiesel imports from Indonesia. The European Union is Indonesia's third-largest export destination for palm oil products and an important market for biodiesel. Responding to this ruling, the Minister of Trade, Budi Santoso, urged the European Union to immediately revoke the countervailing duties. Reuters reported that the European Union may file an appeal, but a final ruling cannot be made because the WTO's highest appellate court has not been operational since 2019 due to President Donald Trump's first administration repeatedly blocking judge appointments. Previously, the European Union imposed countervailing duties of around 8-18% since 2019 on biodiesel originating from Indonesia, driven by accusations that Indonesian biodiesel producers benefited from subsidies, tax incentives, and access to raw materials below market prices. Meanwhile, Indonesia brought the dispute to the WTO in 2023, alleging that the EU's imposition of duties violated WTO rules.
2. The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) announced that it will begin distributing summary trading information at the end of session 1 trading starting Monday (25/8), in addition to the distribution of similar information at the end of the trading day. The files distributed at the end of session 1 include a summary of transaction activities based on investor domicile codes, data on indices listed on the IDX, and a recapitulation of trading based on investor type. All these files are stated to be distributed using the same format as the distribution at the end of the trading day. The IDX explained that the availability of this information is expected to help market participants obtain a more comprehensive overview of investor participation dynamics, while supporting decision-making processes in transactions on the IDX.
3. Commodity analysis firm Kpler estimates that China's seaborne thermal coal imports grew +12.6% MoM to 25.63 million tonnes in August 2025, marking the highest monthly volume since December 2024. Reuters reported that this increase in imports was driven by thermal power generation, a decline in domestic coal production in China, and low coal prices. Meanwhile, Kpler estimates India's thermal coal imports fell -18.8% MoM to 9.74 million tonnes in August 2025, marking the lowest monthly volume since February 2023. Reuters reported that the decline in Indian coal imports was pressured by a shrinking share of thermal power generation amid an increase in new renewable energy sources and an increase in domestic coal production in India.
4. The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources issued new regulations regarding mineral reference prices (HPM) and coal reference prices (HPB) through the Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources Decree No. 268.K/MB.01/MEM.B/2025, which provides flexibility for mining businesses to sell commodities below the reference price while still requiring tax and royalty payments based on the HPM and HPB. The Acting Executive Director of the Indonesian Coal Mining Association, Gita Mahyarani, told Kontan that this rule does not bring significant changes for businesses and is merely a confirmation of the mechanism already in effect.
5. President Prabowo Subianto on Monday (25/8) inaugurated Brian Yuliarto as the Head of the Mineral Industry Agency, a new institution that will oversee the development of rare earths and radioactive materials. Brian currently also serves as the Minister of Higher Education, Science, and Technology.

tickerNews.title: PTPP Wins Rp3.4 Trillion Project to Build Batam Gas Power Plant
tickerNews.content: PTPP: PT PP announced that the company won the Batam Gas and Steam Power Plant (PLTGU) construction project worth 3.35 trillion rupiah owned by PLN. The project will be executed through a joint operation scheme, in which PTPP acts as the leader with an 80% portion. This new contract achievement brings PTPP's total new contract value since the beginning of the year to ~14.8 trillion rupiah (vs. 8M24: 19.1 trillion rupiah, 7M25: 11.8 trillion rupiah) or equivalent to 51.9% of the 2025 target of 28.5 trillion rupiah. PTPP has not yet released detailed data regarding new contract value during 8M25.

tickerNews.title: PT Laut Biru Teknologi Reduces Stake in WIRG
tickerNews.content: WIRG: Wir Asia shareholder, PT Laut Biru Teknologi, sold ~438 million WIRG shares at an average price of 200 rupiah per share on August 21, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~88 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Laut Biru Teknologi's direct ownership stake in WIRG decreased from 8.162% to 4.497%.

tickerNews.title: Gafur Sulistyo Umar Reduces Direct Stake in OASA
tickerNews.content: OASA: The President Director and controller of Maharaksa Biru Energi, Gafur Sulistyo Umar, sold 203.5 million OASA shares at an average price of 160 rupiah per share on August 22, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~32.6 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Gafur Sulistyo Umar's direct ownership stake in OASA decreased from 44.13% to 40.92%.

tickerNews.title: First Resources Limited Plans Tender Offer for ANJT Shares
tickerNews.content: ANJT: Austindo Nusantara Jaya announced that the company's new controller, First Resources Limited, plans to conduct a tender offer for 6.19% of the company's shares at an offering price of 1,813 rupiah per share from August 26 to September 24, 2025. This price is +18.5% higher compared to the ANJT share price at the close of trading on Monday (25/8) at 1,780 rupiah per share and is equivalent to the acquisition price made by First Resources Limited from the previous ANJT shareholders on May 6, 2025.

tickerNews.title: BUAH Plans Stock Split with 1:2 Ratio
tickerNews.content: BUAH: Segar Kumala Indonesia plans to execute a stock split with a 1:2 ratio. The preliminary estimate for trading shares with the new nominal value on the regular and negotiation markets is scheduled for October 22, 2025. This plan will be discussed in the EGM on October 1, 2025.
